title: How to spell Hekate using the ancient Greek alphabet - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: How do you spell Hekate using the ancient Greek alphabet? The name is spelled Ἑκάτη in Ancient Greek alphabet; it is read Hekátē. Don’t confuse the proper name Ἑκάτη and the word ἑκάτη which means either “working at will” or “stake” — they differ because the proper name has capital letter. Don’t confuse the ancient Greek spelling Ἑκάτη and the modern form Εκάτη — they differ because of the rough breathing diacritic mark at the beginning of the word. Also consider that in ancient Greece various dialects were spoken, so probably the goddess’s name was changed in order to fit the dialect. The Doric-Aeolic form would be Ἑκάτᾱ.
Hecate (more authentic Hekatê or Hekatē) is spelt Ἑκάτη in Attic/Ionic/Koine and Modern polytonic and Ἑκάτα in Doric.
